meanings.definition: An enzyme that breaks down hyaluronic acid.
meanings.sent1: Hyaluronidases help in breaking down hyaluronic acid in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of hyaluronidases on hyaluronic acid degradation.
meanings.sent3: The hyaluronidases at the party were busy breaking down the jelly-like substance on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted like hyaluronidases, slowly breaking down the barriers between them.
meanings.sent5: The hyaluronidases worked tirelessly, like tiny demolition experts, breaking apart the hyaluronic acid.

meanings.sent1: The body produces hyaluronidases to degrade hyaluronic acid naturally.
meanings.sent2: Dermatologists use hyaluronidases to target specific areas for hyaluronic acid degradation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous hyaluronidases played a prank by degrading the hyaluronic acid in the skincare products.
meanings.sent4: Time can be like hyaluronidases, slowly degrading the once smooth hyaluronic acid structure.
meanings.sent5: The hyaluronidases worked like tiny cleaners, degrading the excess hyaluronic acid in the system.

meanings.sent1: Certain proteins act as hyaluronidases, helping to hydrolyze hyaluronic acid effectively.
meanings.sent2: The researchers discovered new proteins with the ability to hydrolyze hyaluronic acid, similar to hyaluronidases.
meanings.sent3: The playful proteins dressed up as hyaluronidases for Halloween, pretending to hydrolyze everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: The proteins worked like hyaluronidases, breaking down the hyaluronic acid into simpler components.
meanings.sent5: In the biochemical dance, the proteins moved gracefully, hydrolyzing the hyaluronic acid with precision like hyaluronidases.
